title: Avatar
summary: Set in the distant future, Avatar follows Jake Sully, a former Marine who is given a second chance at purpose when he’s brought to the lush moon of Pandora. As he operates an alien avatar to interact with the native Na’vi, Jake becomes torn between following human orders and protecting the world he comes to love.
story: After losing the use of his legs, Jake Sully is recruited by a corporate-military team to replace his deceased twin in the Avatar Program on Pandora. Through a genetically crafted Na’vi body, he explores the planet’s stunning wildlife and encounters Neytiri, who teaches him the principles and harmony of her clan. While Jake grows attached to the Na’vi, the human company behind the mission prepares to forcibly extract a precious mineral beneath their sacred home. Jake is pushed to choose a side: obey orders or stand against his own people. When the conflict erupts into open war, Jake unites the Na’vi clans and leads a desperate fight to defend Pandora, ultimately embracing a new identity and a new life among the Na’vi.
details: Avatar (2009) is known for transforming modern cinema with its groundbreaking motion-capture technology and immersive 3D world design. James Cameron spent years developing the film’s visual tools, allowing actors’ performances to translate with unprecedented realism into their Na’vi characters. The film’s worldbuilding—ranging from floating mountains to bioluminescent forests—helped create a sense of a living, breathing ecosystem. Beyond its spectacle, the movie explores themes of colonialism, environmental respect, and cultural conflict. Its mix of emotional storytelling, large-scale action, and technical innovation made Avatar one of the most influential films of its era.

timeline.text: James Cameron writes an 80-page treatment for Avatar, originally planned after Titanic.
Cameron announces that advancements in CGI now make Avatar possible; early development begins.
Pre-production officially starts; motion-capture tests and world-design development begin.
Principal photography and performance-capture start in April at stages in Los Angeles and Weta facilities in New Zealand.
Extensive VFX production continues at Weta Digital; editing and 3D pipeline refinement underway.
Final post-production work completed including CGI, sound mixing, and stereoscopic mastering.
Avatar releases theatrically on December 18, 2009, becoming the highest-grossing film of all time.
